Package com.bewsoftware.utils.io

Interface Display

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable, Exceptions
All Known Implementing Classes:
ConsoleIO
public interface Display extends Closeable, Exceptions
This interface provides a means of displaying output in an abstract manner.

By using this interface, it is possible to have multiple implementations, each of which provides a different type or level of output. For instance, the ConsoleIO class provides console level output.

Also, by implementing most of the methods in the interface (default and static), it will make it even simpler to develop additional implementations.

Implementation Note:
The ideas for the various methods, and even some of the implementation code for the default methods was derived from the PrintStream and StringBuilder classes from JDK 15.

The reason for this, was to make it as close as possible to being a minimalist drop-in replacement for System.out. Further more, by including methods from both classes, I believe it makes this class even more useful.

In addition to the methods derived from the above mentioned classes, I have included a few extra helper methods:

  • appendln(java.lang.String)
  • appendln(int)
Since:
1.0.7
Version:
2.1.0
Author:
Bradley Willcott

    • append

      default Display append(boolean value)
      Adds the text equivalent of the value to the internal buffer.
      Implementation Note:
      Uses value ? "true" : "false" to convert value to String.
      Parameters:
      value - to print
      Returns:
      this Display for chaining purposes
      See Also:
      • append(java.lang.String)

    • append

      default Display append(int number)
      Adds the number to the internal buffer.
      Implementation Note:
      Uses Integer.toString(number) to convert int to String.
      Parameters:
      number - to print
      Returns:
      this Display for chaining purposes
      See Also:
      • append(java.lang.String)

    • append

      default Display append(Object obj)
      Adds the obj to the internal buffer.
      Implementation Note:
      Uses obj != null ? obj.toString() : "null" to convert obj to String.
      Parameters:
      obj - to print
      Returns:
      this Display for chaining purposes
